cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi NNW of Grand Cayman and 145 mi SE of the Isle of Youth
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming at southeast Louisiana/mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (roughly Morgan City–New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Borgne, Pontchartrain, Maurepas and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Texas coast (current warnings limited to Cuba and Cayman Islands)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass TX to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Sunday night into Monday with peak 34-kt probability of 18%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible around Sabine Pass and Port Arthur waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could drop 2–6 in. locally, with isolated higher totals if the storm tracks farther west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the upper Texas coast; brief coastal flooding at high tide
